oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Women's Activity Club at Cheatham Place, c.1950s
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of the Women's Activity Club at Cheatham Place (Project Tenn. 5-11), which was the only active tenant group in the project. Built as housing for white tenants during the Housing Division of the Federal PUblic Works Agency's use of Nashville as an experimental field for public housing in the 1930s, Cheatham Place came under control of the Nashville Housing Authority after it was incorporated in 1938. The housing project originally contained 314 units. Photographed by the Nashville Housing Authority, c.1950s. Forms part of the MDHA Photograph Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
